item.title: When to Use Histogram Plots
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use histograms to visualize the distribution of a continous variable
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use Box Plots
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use box plots to visualize the distribution of a continous variable
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use Line Plots
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use line plots to visualize changes in a recorded measurement over time
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use Vertical Grouped Barplots
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use grouped vertical barplots to compare amounts of two or more categories
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use Vertical Stacked Bar Charts
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use vertical stacked bar charts
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use a Vertical Bar Chart
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use a vertical bar chart and how to explain results
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use a Pie Chart
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use a pie chart and how to explain results
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use a Scatter Plot
item.description: Examples of datasets to illustrate when to use a scatter plot and how to explain results
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Intro to Clustering
item.description: An introduction to what clustering is, a comparison to traditional segmentation and why clustering works better for large data
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Intro to Multithreading and Multiprocessing
item.description: Use multithreading and multiprocessing as options for parallel programming in Python to perform tasks at the same time
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman
